opinion:
DISPOSITION OF PETITIONS FOR DISCRETIONARY REVIEW, 348 N.C. 282 (1998)Supreme Court of North Carolina 1998
DISPOSITION OF PETITIONS FOR DISCRETIONARY REVIEW UNDER G.S. 7A-31
EDWARDS v. WEST
No. 129P98
Case below: 125 N.C. App. 742
Petition by defendant for writ of certiorari to review the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals denied 7 May 1998.
EVANS v. TED PARKER HOME SALES, INC.
No. 158P98
Case below: 129 N.C. App. 115 (17 March 1998)
Petition by defendant for discretionary review pursuant to G.S.7A-31 denied 7 May 1998.
FERGUSON v. KILLENS
No. 168P98
Case below: 128 N.C. App. 131 (7 April 1998)
Motion by petitioner for temporary stay allowed 24 April 1998.
FRENCH BROAD ELECTRIC MEMBERSHIP CORP. v. FARMER
No. 113P98
Case below: 128 N.C. App. 748 (17 February 1998)
Petition by plaintiff for discretionary review pursuant to G.S.7A-31 denied 7 May 1998.
GLICKMAN v. COMPUTER INTELLIGENCE, INC.
No. 609P97
Case below: 127 N.C. App. 753
Petition by plaintiff for discretionary review pursuant to G.S.7A-31 denied 6 May 1998.Page 283
